intro: Keckia, commonly known as the silverleaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, silvery-gray leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Keckia species often have small, yellow or white flowers that bloom in clusters. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate drought conditions.
